Civmec,2017-11,"Back in 2009, we had a vision: to create a successful, multidisciplined organisation with a variety of diverse and integrated capabilities. One of our early goals was to prove to our customers the value of local manufacturing and encourage more heavy engineering projects to stay within Australian shores. To this end, we are consistently achieving this goal, with an increasing number of clients realising that value, seeking out our services and returning to us, repeatedly, to deliver to their requirements."
Civmec,2017-11,"I am pleased to report that in FY24, Civmec achieved exceptional financial results, culminating in our revenue surpassing A$1 billion for the first time in our history. Furthermore, we attained our highest ever Net Profit After Tax figure, A$64.4 million - a remarkable achievement that reflects our unrelenting commitment to growth."
Civmec,2017-11,"We strengthened our cash position, transitioning from a net borrowing position of A$76.5 million in FY19 to a net cash position of A$24.5 million (excluding lease liabilities). Our increased net assets now stand at an impressive A$488.2 million. These achievements underscore the effectiveness of our financial strategy over the past fifteen years. We will continue to focus on cash generation and the maintenance of a strong balance sheet to support our strong operational performance and growth strategy."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our objective at Civmec is to create value for shareholders through delivering consistent, stable and reliable returns. Since our listing on the ASX, we have generated A$232.2 million in profit and returned more than A$75.5 million to our shareholders through dividends."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our Board of Directors has declared a final cash dividend of A$0.035 per share. The payment will bring the full-year dividend to A$0.06 per share, representing a 47% payout ratio, and will be paid on 25 October 2024."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our people are the heartbeat of our direct operations and support services, and, without them, we wouldn't be where we are today. During FY24, we provided employment either directly or indirectly for over 4,000 people, including almost 150 apprentices, graduates, and trainees."

In fact, this year, it is pleasing to report that around 90 people completed our leading hand or supervisory position courses, successfully progressing to the next stages of their career with us."
Civmec,2017-11,"It's important that everyone at Civmec feels equally valued and welcome, so we continue to promote diversity across our facilities and sites with visible action and representation. This year, a personal highlight of mine was hosting the Matagarup Elders Group for a tour of our Henderson facility, during which the group generously provided insight into their culture and connection to the lands and waters in Perth."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our journey towards a more sustainable future continues, as we strive for the most effective management of our environmental, social and governance (ESG) risks, obligations and opportunities. The Board has committed to a target of net zero emissions by 2050, and to achieve this has set a target of greater than 50% reduction in Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions intensity by 2030 (compared to 2022 levels)."

Civmec,2017-11,[*Volume Index of 3.1 means volume for the month was 3.1 times its 12-month average]
Civmec,2017-11,[VWAP is defined as the Volume Weighted Average Price; High Low prices and VWAP are shown in Australian Dollars]
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec today announced a final dividend of 3.50c per share, franked to 100%. The ex-dividend date is Monday, October 14, 2024 and the record date is Tuesday, October 15, 2024 and it is payable on Friday, October 25."
Civmec,2017-11,"Back in 2009, we had a vision: to create a successful, multidisciplined organisation with a variety of diverse and integrated capabilities. One of our early goals was to prove to our customers the value of local manufacturing and encourage more heavy engineering projects to stay within Australian shores. To this end, we are consistently achieving this goal, with an increasing number of clients realising that value, seeking out our services and returning to us, repeatedly, to deliver to their requirements."
Civmec,2017-11,"I am pleased to report that in FY24, Civmec achieved exceptional financial results, culminating in our revenue surpassing A$1 billion for the first time in our history. Furthermore, we attained our highest ever Net Profit After Tax figure, A$64.4 million - a remarkable achievement that reflects our unrelenting commitment to growth."
Civmec,2017-11,"We strengthened our cash position, transitioning from a net borrowing position of A$76.5 million in FY19 to a net cash position of A$24.5 million (excluding lease liabilities). Our increased net assets now stand at an impressive A$488.2 million. These achievements underscore the effectiveness of our financial strategy over the past fifteen years. We will continue to focus on cash generation and the maintenance of a strong balance sheet to support our strong operational performance and growth strategy."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our objective at Civmec is to create value for shareholders through delivering consistent, stable and reliable returns. Since our listing on the ASX, we have generated A$232.2 million in profit and returned more than A$75.5 million to our shareholders through dividends."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our Board of Directors has declared a final cash dividend of A$0.035 per share. The payment will bring the full-year dividend to A$0.06 per share, representing a 47% payout ratio, and will be paid on 25 October 2024."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our people are the heartbeat of our direct operations and support services, and, without them, we wouldn't be where we are today. During FY24, we provided employment either directly or indirectly for over 4,000 people, including almost 150 apprentices, graduates, and trainees."
Civmec,2017-11,"We also continued to equip workers with additional skills, delivering 56 units of competency to almost 2,500 participants through our in-house registered training organisation (RTO)."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our leadership and professional development programs, such as our internal LEAD program, were ongoing, reaffirming our strong commitment to the promotion of organic growth within the company. In fact, this year, it is pleasing to report that around 90 people completed our leading hand or supervisory position courses, successfully progressing to the next stages of their career with us."
Civmec,2017-11,"It's important that everyone at Civmec feels equally valued and welcome, so we continue to promote diversity across our facilities and sites with visible action and representation. This year, a personal highlight of mine was hosting the Matagarup Elders Group for a tour of our Henderson facility, during which the group generously provided insight into their culture and connection to the lands and waters in Perth."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our journey towards a more sustainable future continues, as we strive for the most effective management of our environmental, social and governance (ESG) risks, obligations and opportunities. The Board has committed to a target of net zero emissions by 2050, and to achieve this has set a target of greater than 50% reduction in Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions intensity by 2030 (compared to 2022 levels)."
Civmec,2017-11,"At Civmec, we are unwavering in our commitment to responsible corporate governance and transparency, striving for the highest levels of integrity and accountability. For the past twelve years, we have done so with the support of Independent Directors Chong Teck Sin, Wong Fook Choy Sunny, and Douglas Owen Chester, whose time with us will end in October 2024 due to SGX Listing Rules on director independence."
Civmec,2017-11,"Mr. Gary Gray is a distinguished professional with experience as the Australian Ambassador to Ireland, a former member of the Australian Parliament, and in senior executive and Board member roles. Mr. Ambrose Law is a seasoned Chartered Accountant with extensive experience in senior financial roles across multiple countries. I am confident that their strategic guidance and oversight will add great value, as we continue to deliver safely, sustainably, and in the best interests of our stakeholders."
Civmec,2017-11,"To conclude, I wish to thank all those who have played a role in our success, not just this year, but since we opened our doors in 2009. This includes our employees, our delivery partners, suppliers, clients, executive management team and our Board. As we prepare to bid our current Independent Directors farewell, I would like to take the opportunity to sincerely thank them for their insight and guidance over the years. Their contributions have been instrumental in our journey of success."
Civmec,2017-11,"Finally, to our shareholders, thank you for your continued trust and confidence in Civmec. Your ongoing support and encouragement are much appreciated."
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec has announced its Annual General Meeting will take place on Wednesday, October 30."
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec has announced its Extra Ordinary General Meeting will take place on Thursday, August 01."
Civmec,2017-11,June 13: Civmec: Target increased as Civmec aims to raise record amount for Vinnies
Civmec,2017-11,"With the Vinnies CEO Sleepout only one week away, Civmec has increased the fundraising target of its national campaign, with an aim to raise more money and awareness for people in need. Having reached his personal target of $100,000 earlier this week, Civmec CEO Pat Tallon is now aiming for $125,000, raising the Civmec team target to $145,000."

Civmec,2017-11,"Homelessness can happen to anyone. It may be an unfortunate life event, breakdown of a relationship, or unforeseen change in circumstances. It affects men and women, young and old, including many Australian children."
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec is relying on the generosity of its people, their friends and family, its suppliers, delivery partners, and the wider Australian public, to reach the target amount."

Civmec,2017-11,4.1 Relative Value Indicators: Undervaluation compared with Index averages and bond yield
Civmec,2017-11,- Earnings yield of 9.8% is more attractive compared with the Australian average earning yield of 1.7%.
Civmec,2017-11,- The earnings yield of 9.8% is 2.1 times the 10-year bond yield of 4.6%.
Civmec,2017-11,The dividend yield of 6.77% is 1.47 times the triple-A bond yield of 4.59%. The times factor of 1.47 is above the benchmark factor of 0.67 times set by Benjamin Graham.
Civmec,2017-11,The Dividend Yield of 6.8% is better than the Index average of 3.2%
Civmec,2017-11,"- The relative yield of the stock, defined by its yield of 6.8%, divided by average yield of dividend yielding stocks in the All Ordinaries Index of 3.2% is 209.0%. This suggests the stock is undervalued in dividend yield terms."

It is higher than the Price/MAP 200 for the All Ordinaries Index of 1.05, a second bullish indicator. Civmec,2017-11,"- The price to 50-day EMAP ratio is 1.1, a bullish indicator. In the past 50 days this ratio has exceeded 1.1, 23 times suggesting further upside. The 50-day EMAP has increased to $A1.23. An increase is another bullish indicator."

Civmec,2017-11,"- ""An earnings-to-price yield of at least twice the triple-A bond""; the stock's earning yield of 9.8% is 2.1 times the triple-A bond yield of 4.6%."
Civmec,2017-11,"- ""A dividend yield of at least two-thirds the triple-A bond yield""; the stock's dividend yield is 1.5 times the triple-A bond yield of 4.6%."

Civmec,2017-11,Annual Return: Dividends Paid In a 12-Month Period/Price at the Beginning of the Period + Capital Gain or Loss over 1 Year/Price 1 Year Ago (%)
Civmec,2017-11,Moving Average Price (n periods): Sum of Prices for each Period/Number of Periods
Civmec,2017-11,Price Close/Moving Avg Price: Latest Price/Moving Average Price
Civmec,2017-11,Price/NTA: Closing Share Price/Net Tangible Assets Per Share (times)
Civmec,2017-11,Relative Price Change [RPC]: Relative price change is price change of stock with respect to Benchmark Index
Civmec,2017-11,"Relative Strength (6 Months): Price close today/Price close 6 months ago, then ranked by percentile within the entire market."
Civmec,2017-11,TSR: Total Shareholder Returns is expressed as an annualized rate of return for shareholders after allowing for capital appreciation and dividend
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Index (VI): Number of shares traded in the period/Average number of shares traded for the period
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP): The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover divided by total volume in the same period.
Civmec,2017-11,"Data for the BuySellSignals algorithms is drawn from annual reports, company websites and similar sources of publicly available data. It should be used as a guide only."

Civmec,2017-11,"CIVMEC (P9D) Stock Dashboard [traded in Singapore Dollars, SGD] End-of-Day Fri, Nov 08"
Civmec,2017-11,VI* Volume Index = Number of shares traded today/Average number of shares traded per day.
Civmec,2017-11,"A year ago the exchange rate was USD 1 = 1.35 SGD. USD1000 would have bought SGD1,355. A year ago the Civmec share price was 72.79c. SGD1,355 would have bought 1,861.3 Civmec shares on that day. Those 1,861.3 shares would be worth SGD2,159 at today's share price of SGD1.16. At today's exchange rate of USD1=1.32 SGD this is equivalent to USD1,633. Dividends reinvested are worth SGD105 ($107). PV$1000= $1,741."
Civmec,2017-11,"- Market Capitalization has increased by SGD290.7 million from SGD298.1 million to SGD588.8 million in the last 2 years. This increase comprises cumulative retained earnings (RETE) of SGD70.2 million and Created Market Value of SGD220.6 million. The Created Market Value multiple, defined by the change in MCap for every SGD1 of retained earnings is exemplary at SGD4.14."
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec Ltd. is an integrated multi-disciplinary construction and heavy engineering services provider to the oil and gas, mining and other industries, such as the infrastructure, utilities, chemical and power industries. The Company provides heavy engineering and other services including fabrication, site civil works, pre-cast concrete and maintenance services. It is Singapore's largest Construction and Engineering company by market capitalisation."
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec has announced its Annual General Meeting will take place on Wednesday, October 30."

Civmec,2017-11,"Stocks are scored on a set of parameters reflecting fundamental analytical tools involving valuation, size and financial performance. They are ranked according to the average values of those parameters. The highest ranking is 5 and the lowest ranking is 1."
Civmec,2017-11,Annual Return: Dividends Paid In a 12-Month Period/Price at the Beginning of the Period + Capital Gain or Loss over 1 Year/Price 1 Year Ago (%)
Civmec,2017-11,Moving Average Price (n periods): Sum of Prices for each Period/Number of Periods
Civmec,2017-11,Price Close/Moving Avg Price: Latest Price/Moving Average Price
Civmec,2017-11,Price/NTA: Closing Share Price/Net Tangible Assets Per Share (times)
Civmec,2017-11,Relative Price Change [RPC]: Relative price change is price change of stock with respect to Benchmark Index
Civmec,2017-11,"Relative Strength (6 Months): Price close today/Price close 6 months ago, then ranked by percentile within the entire market."
Civmec,2017-11,TSR: Total Shareholder Returns is expressed as an annualized rate of return for shareholders after allowing for capital appreciation and dividend
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Index (VI): Number of shares traded in the period/Average number of shares traded for the period
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP): The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover divided by total volume in the same period.
Civmec,2017-11,"Data for the BuySellSignals algorithms is drawn from annual reports, company websites and similar sources of publicly available data. It should be used as a guide only."

Civmec,2017-11,Annual Return: Dividends Paid In a 12-Month Period/Price at the Beginning of the Period + Capital Gain or Loss over 1 Year/Price 1 Year Ago (%)
Civmec,2017-11,Moving Average Price (n periods): Sum of Prices for each Period/Number of Periods
Civmec,2017-11,Price Close/Moving Avg Price: Latest Price/Moving Average Price
Civmec,2017-11,Price/NTA: Closing Share Price/Net Tangible Assets Per Share (times)
Civmec,2017-11,Relative Price Change [RPC]: Relative price change is price change of stock with respect to Benchmark Index
Civmec,2017-11,"Relative Strength (6 Months): Price close today/Price close 6 months ago, then ranked by percentile within the entire market."
Civmec,2017-11,TSR: Total Shareholder Returns is expressed as an annualized rate of return for shareholders after allowing for capital appreciation and dividend
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Index (VI): Number of shares traded in the period/Average number of shares traded for the period
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP): The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover divided by total volume in the same period.
Civmec,2017-11,"Data for the BuySellSignals algorithms is drawn from annual reports, company websites and similar sources of publicly available data. It should be used as a guide only."

To this end, we are consistently achieving this goal, with an increasing number of clients realising that value, seeking out our services and returning to us, repeatedly, to deliver to their requirements."

Our increased net assets now stand at an impressive A$488.2 million. These achievements underscore the effectiveness of our financial strategy over the past fifteen years. We will continue to focus on cash generation and the maintenance of a strong balance sheet to support our strong operational performance and growth strategy."

Over the past 28 years, Mr. Tallon has accumulated significant knowledge and experience in all aspects of the construction industry and has been involved in many major oil and gas, mining and infrastructure projects."

With more than 34 years' experience, he has extensive knowledge in civil, structural, mechanical and piping works, as well as insulation and modularisation of structures onshore and offshore."

He is responsible for overseeing the ongoing business operations of the Group's quality-orientated culture compliance and operational productivity. Mr. Deery has more than 20 years' experience having previously managed structural, mechanical and process piping construction works for major clients."
Civmec,2017-11,"Mr. Sunny Wong Fook Choy was appointed to our Board on 27 March 2012. He is a practising advocate and solicitor of the Supreme Court of Singapore and is currently the Managing Director of Wong Tan & Molly Lim LLC. He is also an independent director of China Medical (International) Group Limited, Excelpoint Technology Ltd., Mencast Holdings Ltd., InnoTek Ltd. and KTL Global Ltd. Mr. Wong holds a Bachelor of Law (Honours) from the National University of Singapore."
Civmec,2017-11,"Mr. Douglas Owen Chester was appointed to our Board on 2 November 2012. He is an Independent Director and Audit Chairman of Stamford Land Corporation Limited and Lead Independent Director of Kim Heng Offshore & Marine Holdings Limited. Prior to this appointment, he held the role of Australia's High Commissioner to Singapore. Mr. Chester holds a Bachelor of Science (Honours) from the Australian National University."

Ltd. and Audit Committee Chairman of AVIC International Maritime Holdings Limited, InnoTek Limited and Accordia Golf Trust Management Pte. Ltd. Mr. Chong has a Bachelor of Engineering from the University of Tokyo and a Masters of Business Administration from the National University of Singapore."

Civmec,2017-11,"Stocks are scored on a set of parameters reflecting fundamental analytical tools involving valuation, size and financial performance. They are ranked according to the average values of those parameters. The highest ranking is 5 and the lowest ranking is 1."
Civmec,2017-11,Annual Return: Dividends Paid In a 12-Month Period/Price at the Beginning of the Period + Capital Gain or Loss over 1 Year/Price 1 Year Ago (%)
Civmec,2017-11,Moving Average Price (n periods): Sum of Prices for each Period/Number of Periods
Civmec,2017-11,Price Close/Moving Avg Price: Latest Price/Moving Average Price
Civmec,2017-11,Price/NTA: Closing Share Price/Net Tangible Assets Per Share (times)
Civmec,2017-11,Relative Price Change [RPC]: Relative price change is price change of stock with respect to Benchmark Index
Civmec,2017-11,"Relative Strength (6 Months): Price close today/Price close 6 months ago, then ranked by percentile within the entire market."
Civmec,2017-11,TSR: Total Shareholder Returns is expressed as an annualized rate of return for shareholders after allowing for capital appreciation and dividend
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Index (VI): Number of shares traded in the period/Average number of shares traded for the period
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP): The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover divided by total volume in the same period.
Civmec,2017-11,"Data for the BuySellSignals algorithms is drawn from annual reports, company websites and similar sources of publicly available data. It should be used as a guide only."

A year ago the Civmec share price was 91.83c. $A1,537 would have bought 1,673.9 Civmec shares on that day. Those 1,673.9 shares would be worth $A2,260 at today's share price of $A1.35. Civmec,2017-11,"Back in 2009, we had a vision: to create a successful, multidisciplined organisation with a variety of diverse and integrated capabilities. One of our early goals was to prove to our customers the value of local manufacturing and encourage more heavy engineering projects to stay within Australian shores. To this end, we are consistently achieving this goal, with an increasing number of clients realising that value, seeking out our services and returning to us, repeatedly, to deliver to their requirements."
Civmec,2017-11,"I am pleased to report that in FY24, Civmec achieved exceptional financial results, culminating in our revenue surpassing A$1 billion for the first time in our history. Furthermore, we attained our highest ever Net Profit After Tax figure, A$64.4 million - a remarkable achievement that reflects our unrelenting commitment to growth."
Civmec,2017-11,"We strengthened our cash position, transitioning from a net borrowing position of A$76.5 million in FY19 to a net cash position of A$24.5 million (excluding lease liabilities). Our increased net assets now stand at an impressive A$488.2 million. These achievements underscore the effectiveness of our financial strategy over the past fifteen years. We will continue to focus on cash generation and the maintenance of a strong balance sheet to support our strong operational performance and growth strategy."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our objective at Civmec is to create value for shareholders through delivering consistent, stable and reliable returns. Since our listing on the ASX, we have generated A$232.2 million in profit and returned more than A$75.5 million to our shareholders through dividends."

Civmec,2017-11,"Our people are the heartbeat of our direct operations and support services, and, without them, we wouldn't be where we are today. During FY24, we provided employment either directly or indirectly for over 4,000 people, including almost 150 apprentices, graduates, and trainees."

In fact, this year, it is pleasing to report that around 90 people completed our leading hand or supervisory position courses, successfully progressing to the next stages of their career with us."

This year, a personal highlight of mine was hosting the Matagarup Elders Group for a tour of our Henderson facility, during which the group generously provided insight into their culture and connection to the lands and waters in Perth."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our journey towards a more sustainable future continues, as we strive for the most effective management of our environmental, social and governance (ESG) risks, obligations and opportunities. The Board has committed to a target of net zero emissions by 2050, and to achieve this has set a target of greater than 50% reduction in Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions intensity by 2030 (compared to 2022 levels)."

Civmec,2017-11,Annual Return: Dividends Paid In a 12-Month Period/Price at the Beginning of the Period + Capital Gain or Loss over 1 Year/Price 1 Year Ago (%)
Civmec,2017-11,Moving Average Price (n periods): Sum of Prices for each Period/Number of Periods
Civmec,2017-11,Price Close/Moving Avg Price: Latest Price/Moving Average Price
Civmec,2017-11,Price/NTA: Closing Share Price/Net Tangible Assets Per Share (times)
Civmec,2017-11,Relative Price Change [RPC]: Relative price change is price change of stock with respect to Benchmark Index
Civmec,2017-11,"Relative Strength (6 Months): Price close today/Price close 6 months ago, then ranked by percentile within the entire market."
Civmec,2017-11,TSR: Total Shareholder Returns is expressed as an annualized rate of return for shareholders after allowing for capital appreciation and dividend
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Index (VI): Number of shares traded in the period/Average number of shares traded for the period
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP): The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover divided by total volume in the same period.
Civmec,2017-11,"Data for the BuySellSignals algorithms is drawn from annual reports, company websites and similar sources of publicly available data. It should be used as a guide only."

Civmec,2017-11,"Stocks are scored on a set of parameters reflecting fundamental analytical tools involving valuation, size and financial performance. They are ranked according to the average values of those parameters. The highest ranking is 5 and the lowest ranking is 1."
Civmec,2017-11,Annual Return: Dividends Paid In a 12-Month Period/Price at the Beginning of the Period + Capital Gain or Loss over 1 Year/Price 1 Year Ago (%)
Civmec,2017-11,Moving Average Price (n periods): Sum of Prices for each Period/Number of Periods
Civmec,2017-11,Price Close/Moving Avg Price: Latest Price/Moving Average Price
Civmec,2017-11,Price/NTA: Closing Share Price/Net Tangible Assets Per Share (times)
Civmec,2017-11,Relative Price Change [RPC]: Relative price change is price change of stock with respect to Benchmark Index
Civmec,2017-11,"Relative Strength (6 Months): Price close today/Price close 6 months ago, then ranked by percentile within the entire market."
Civmec,2017-11,TSR: Total Shareholder Returns is expressed as an annualized rate of return for shareholders after allowing for capital appreciation and dividend
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Index (VI): Number of shares traded in the period/Average number of shares traded for the period
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP): The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover divided by total volume in the same period.

Civmec,2017-11,Civmec Limited's (ASX: CVL $A1.33) stock price dropped 4.0c (2.9%) over the past two trading days.
Civmec,2017-11,The stock fell 2.0c (1.5%) on Wednesday and 2.0c (1.5%) on Thursday to close at $A1.33; compared with the All Ordinaries Index which rose 93.8 points (1.1%) in the two days for a relative price change of -4.0%.
Civmec,2017-11,"The fall was exacerbated by a cumulative 2-day volume of 2.3 times the average 2-day volume of 68,651 shares. There were 303,220 shares worth $A403,283 traded today."
Civmec,2017-11,Today its volatility (highest price minus lowest price/lowest price) of 4.5% was 1.7 times its average daily volatility of 2.6%. Today the stock traded at its ten-day low of $A1.33. The high for the day was $A1.39.
Civmec,2017-11,Civmec Limited is Australia's 10th largest Capital goods company by market cap.
Civmec,2017-11,"CIVMEC (CVL) Stock Dashboard [traded in Australian Dollars, AUD] End-of-Day Thu, Nov 07"
Civmec,2017-11,"A year ago the exchange rate was USD 1 = 1.54 AUD. USD1000 would have bought $A1,538. A year ago the Civmec share price was 91.83c. $A1,538 would have bought 1,675.2 Civmec shares on that day. Those 1,675.2 shares would be worth $A2,228 at today's share price of $A1.33. At today's exchange rate of USD1=1.52 AUD this is equivalent to USD1,465. Dividends reinvested are worth $A130 ($132). PV$1000= $1,596."
Civmec,2017-11,It is Australia's 10th largest Capital goods company by market capitalisation.
Civmec,2017-11,The shares soared 5.6% in the 18 trading sessions since the ex-dividend date of October 14. The company paid a dividend of 3.50c per share. Based on dividends of 9.0c per share for the trailing twelve months and the last price of $A1.33 the dividend yield is 6.8%.
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec (ASX:CVL) reported net profit for the year-ended 30 June 2024 [FY2024] of $A64.4m, up 12% from $A57.7m in the previous year [FY2023]. Earnings per share (EPS) were up 18% from 11.0c in FY2023 to 13.0c in FY2024."
Civmec,2017-11,"The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover [or price at which shares were sold times the volume of shares] divided by the total volume and represents an average based on turnover of all transactions over the period. In the past week the Volume Weighted Average Price was $A1.35, up from $A1.35 in the previous week. Average weekly volume of 343,255 shares rose 3.4% from 331,885 shares. The 5-week VWAP is $A1.30."
Civmec,2017-11,Week-Ended Thu   High   Low   Turnover    Mid-Bounce Price   Av weekly volume   VWAP
Civmec,2017-11,VI* Volume Index = Number of shares traded today/Average number of shares traded per day.
Civmec,2017-11,Past quarter momentum up: Civmec soars 21% on high volume 2.0 times average.
Civmec,2017-11,Average monthly volumes have risen in the past quarter and have been consistently above 1.2. In the past month average volumes were 3.2 times average.
Civmec,2017-11,[*Volume Index of 3.2 means volume for the month was 3.2 times its 12-month average]
Civmec,2017-11,[VWAP is defined as the Volume Weighted Average Price; High Low prices and VWAP are shown in Australian Dollars]
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec today announced a final dividend of 3.50c per share, franked to 100%. The ex-dividend date is Monday, October 14, 2024 and the record date is Tuesday, October 15, 2024 and it is payable on Friday, October 25."
Civmec,2017-11,"Back in 2009, we had a vision: to create a successful, multidisciplined organisation with a variety of diverse and integrated capabilities. One of our early goals was to prove to our customers the value of local manufacturing and encourage more heavy engineering projects to stay within Australian shores. To this end, we are consistently achieving this goal, with an increasing number of clients realising that value, seeking out our services and returning to us, repeatedly, to deliver to their requirements."
Civmec,2017-11,"I am pleased to report that in FY24, Civmec achieved exceptional financial results, culminating in our revenue surpassing A$1 billion for the first time in our history. Furthermore, we attained our highest ever Net Profit After Tax figure, A$64.4 million - a remarkable achievement that reflects our unrelenting commitment to growth."
Civmec,2017-11,"We strengthened our cash position, transitioning from a net borrowing position of A$76.5 million in FY19 to a net cash position of A$24.5 million (excluding lease liabilities). Our increased net assets now stand at an impressive A$488.2 million. These achievements underscore the effectiveness of our financial strategy over the past fifteen years. We will continue to focus on cash generation and the maintenance of a strong balance sheet to support our strong operational performance and growth strategy."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our objective at Civmec is to create value for shareholders through delivering consistent, stable and reliable returns. Since our listing on the ASX, we have generated A$232.2 million in profit and returned more than A$75.5 million to our shareholders through dividends."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our Board of Directors has declared a final cash dividend of A$0.035 per share. The payment will bring the full-year dividend to A$0.06 per share, representing a 47% payout ratio, and will be paid on 25 October 2024."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our people are the heartbeat of our direct operations and support services, and, without them, we wouldn't be where we are today. During FY24, we provided employment either directly or indirectly for over 4,000 people, including almost 150 apprentices, graduates, and trainees."
Civmec,2017-11,"We also continued to equip workers with additional skills, delivering 56 units of competency to almost 2,500 participants through our in-house registered training organisation (RTO)."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our leadership and professional development programs, such as our internal LEAD program, were ongoing, reaffirming our strong commitment to the promotion of organic growth within the company. In fact, this year, it is pleasing to report that around 90 people completed our leading hand or supervisory position courses, successfully progressing to the next stages of their career with us."
Civmec,2017-11,"It's important that everyone at Civmec feels equally valued and welcome, so we continue to promote diversity across our facilities and sites with visible action and representation. This year, a personal highlight of mine was hosting the Matagarup Elders Group for a tour of our Henderson facility, during which the group generously provided insight into their culture and connection to the lands and waters in Perth."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our journey towards a more sustainable future continues, as we strive for the most effective management of our environmental, social and governance (ESG) risks, obligations and opportunities. The Board has committed to a target of net zero emissions by 2050, and to achieve this has set a target of greater than 50% reduction in Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions intensity by 2030 (compared to 2022 levels)."
Civmec,2017-11,"At Civmec, we are unwavering in our commitment to responsible corporate governance and transparency, striving for the highest levels of integrity and accountability. For the past twelve years, we have done so with the support of Independent Directors Chong Teck Sin, Wong Fook Choy Sunny, and Douglas Owen Chester, whose time with us will end in October 2024 due to SGX Listing Rules on director independence."
Civmec,2017-11,"Mr. Gary Gray is a distinguished professional with experience as the Australian Ambassador to Ireland, a former member of the Australian Parliament, and in senior executive and Board member roles. Mr. Ambrose Law is a seasoned Chartered Accountant with extensive experience in senior financial roles across multiple countries. I am confident that their strategic guidance and oversight will add great value, as we continue to deliver safely, sustainably, and in the best interests of our stakeholders."
Civmec,2017-11,"To conclude, I wish to thank all those who have played a role in our success, not just this year, but since we opened our doors in 2009. This includes our employees, our delivery partners, suppliers, clients, executive management team and our Board. As we prepare to bid our current Independent Directors farewell, I would like to take the opportunity to sincerely thank them for their insight and guidance over the years. Their contributions have been instrumental in our journey of success."
Civmec,2017-11,"Finally, to our shareholders, thank you for your continued trust and confidence in Civmec. Your ongoing support and encouragement are much appreciated."

Civmec,2017-11,4.1 Relative Value Indicators: Undervaluation compared with Index averages and bond yield
Civmec,2017-11,- Earnings yield of 9.8% is more attractive compared with the Australian average earning yield of 1.7%.

Civmec,2017-11,The dividend yield of 6.77% is 1.45 times the triple-A bond yield of 4.66%. The times factor of 1.45 is above the benchmark factor of 0.67 times set by Benjamin Graham.
Civmec,2017-11,The Dividend Yield of 6.8% is better than the Index average of 3.3%
Civmec,2017-11,"- The relative yield of the stock, defined by its yield of 6.8%, divided by average yield of dividend yielding stocks in the All Ordinaries Index of 3.3% is 207.0%. This suggests the stock is undervalued in dividend yield terms."

Civmec,2017-11,Annual Return: Dividends Paid In a 12-Month Period/Price at the Beginning of the Period + Capital Gain or Loss over 1 Year/Price 1 Year Ago (%)
Civmec,2017-11,Moving Average Price (n periods): Sum of Prices for each Period/Number of Periods
Civmec,2017-11,Price Close/Moving Avg Price: Latest Price/Moving Average Price
Civmec,2017-11,Price/NTA: Closing Share Price/Net Tangible Assets Per Share (times)
Civmec,2017-11,Relative Price Change [RPC]: Relative price change is price change of stock with respect to Benchmark Index
Civmec,2017-11,"Relative Strength (6 Months): Price close today/Price close 6 months ago, then ranked by percentile within the entire market."
Civmec,2017-11,TSR: Total Shareholder Returns is expressed as an annualized rate of return for shareholders after allowing for capital appreciation and dividend
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Index (VI): Number of shares traded in the period/Average number of shares traded for the period
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP): The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover divided by total volume in the same period.
Civmec,2017-11,"Data for the BuySellSignals algorithms is drawn from annual reports, company websites and similar sources of publicly available data. It should be used as a guide only."

Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec today announced a final dividend of 3.50c per share, franked to 100%. The ex-dividend date is Monday, October 14, 2024 and the record date is Tuesday, October 15, 2024 and it is payable on Friday, October 25."
Civmec,2017-11,"Back in 2009, we had a vision: to create a successful, multidisciplined organisation with a variety of diverse and integrated capabilities. One of our early goals was to prove to our customers the value of local manufacturing and encourage more heavy engineering projects to stay within Australian shores. To this end, we are consistently achieving this goal, with an increasing number of clients realising that value, seeking out our services and returning to us, repeatedly, to deliver to their requirements."
Civmec,2017-11,"I am pleased to report that in FY24, Civmec achieved exceptional financial results, culminating in our revenue surpassing A$1 billion for the first time in our history. Furthermore, we attained our highest ever Net Profit After Tax figure, A$64.4 million - a remarkable achievement that reflects our unrelenting commitment to growth."
Civmec,2017-11,"We strengthened our cash position, transitioning from a net borrowing position of A$76.5 million in FY19 to a net cash position of A$24.5 million (excluding lease liabilities). Our increased net assets now stand at an impressive A$488.2 million. These achievements underscore the effectiveness of our financial strategy over the past fifteen years. We will continue to focus on cash generation and the maintenance of a strong balance sheet to support our strong operational performance and growth strategy."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our objective at Civmec is to create value for shareholders through delivering consistent, stable and reliable returns. Since our listing on the ASX, we have generated A$232.2 million in profit and returned more than A$75.5 million to our shareholders through dividends."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our Board of Directors has declared a final cash dividend of A$0.035 per share. The payment will bring the full-year dividend to A$0.06 per share, representing a 47% payout ratio, and will be paid on 25 October 2024."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our people are the heartbeat of our direct operations and support services, and, without them, we wouldn't be where we are today. During FY24, we provided employment either directly or indirectly for over 4,000 people, including almost 150 apprentices, graduates, and trainees."
Civmec,2017-11,"We also continued to equip workers with additional skills, delivering 56 units of competency to almost 2,500 participants through our in-house registered training organisation (RTO)."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our leadership and professional development programs, such as our internal LEAD program, were ongoing, reaffirming our strong commitment to the promotion of organic growth within the company. In fact, this year, it is pleasing to report that around 90 people completed our leading hand or supervisory position courses, successfully progressing to the next stages of their career with us."
Civmec,2017-11,"It's important that everyone at Civmec feels equally valued and welcome, so we continue to promote diversity across our facilities and sites with visible action and representation. This year, a personal highlight of mine was hosting the Matagarup Elders Group for a tour of our Henderson facility, during which the group generously provided insight into their culture and connection to the lands and waters in Perth."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our journey towards a more sustainable future continues, as we strive for the most effective management of our environmental, social and governance (ESG) risks, obligations and opportunities. The Board has committed to a target of net zero emissions by 2050, and to achieve this has set a target of greater than 50% reduction in Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions intensity by 2030 (compared to 2022 levels)."
Civmec,2017-11,"At Civmec, we are unwavering in our commitment to responsible corporate governance and transparency, striving for the highest levels of integrity and accountability. For the past twelve years, we have done so with the support of Independent Directors Chong Teck Sin, Wong Fook Choy Sunny, and Douglas Owen Chester, whose time with us will end in October 2024 due to SGX Listing Rules on director independence."

Mr. Ambrose Law is a seasoned Chartered Accountant with extensive experience in senior financial roles across multiple countries. I am confident that their strategic guidance and oversight will add great value, as we continue to deliver safely, sustainably, and in the best interests of our stakeholders."

This includes our employees, our delivery partners, suppliers, clients, executive management team and our Board. Civmec,2017-11,3.1 Relative Value Indicators: Undervaluation compared with Index averages and bond yield
Civmec,2017-11,- Earnings yield of 9.8% is more attractive compared with the Australian average earning yield of 1.7%.
Civmec,2017-11,- The earnings yield of 9.8% is 2.1 times the 10-year bond yield of 4.7%.
Civmec,2017-11,The dividend yield of 6.77% is 1.45 times the triple-A bond yield of 4.66%. The times factor of 1.45 is above the benchmark factor of 0.67 times set by Benjamin Graham.
Civmec,2017-11,The Dividend Yield of 6.8% is better than the Index average of 3.3%

Mr. Wong holds a Bachelor of Law (Honours) from the National University of Singapore."

He is an Independent Director and Audit Chairman of Stamford Land Corporation Limited and Lead Independent Director of Kim Heng Offshore & Marine Holdings Limited. Prior to this appointment, he held the role of Australia's High Commissioner to Singapore. Mr. Chester holds a Bachelor of Science (Honours) from the Australian National University."

Civmec,2017-11,"Stocks are scored on a set of parameters reflecting fundamental analytical tools involving valuation, size and financial performance. They are ranked according to the average values of those parameters. The highest ranking is 5 and the lowest ranking is 1."
Civmec,2017-11,Annual Return: Dividends Paid In a 12-Month Period/Price at the Beginning of the Period + Capital Gain or Loss over 1 Year/Price 1 Year Ago (%)
Civmec,2017-11,Moving Average Price (n periods): Sum of Prices for each Period/Number of Periods
Civmec,2017-11,Price Close/Moving Avg Price: Latest Price/Moving Average Price
Civmec,2017-11,Price/NTA: Closing Share Price/Net Tangible Assets Per Share (times)
Civmec,2017-11,Relative Price Change [RPC]: Relative price change is price change of stock with respect to Benchmark Index
Civmec,2017-11,"Relative Strength (6 Months): Price close today/Price close 6 months ago, then ranked by percentile within the entire market."
Civmec,2017-11,TSR: Total Shareholder Returns is expressed as an annualized rate of return for shareholders after allowing for capital appreciation and dividend
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Index (VI): Number of shares traded in the period/Average number of shares traded for the period
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP): The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover divided by total volume in the same period.
Civmec,2017-11,"Data for the BuySellSignals algorithms is drawn from annual reports, company websites and similar sources of publicly available data. It should be used as a guide only."

Civmec,2017-11,"Back in 2009, we had a vision: to create a successful, multidisciplined organisation with a variety of diverse and integrated capabilities. One of our early goals was to prove to our customers the value of local manufacturing and encourage more heavy engineering projects to stay within Australian shores. To this end, we are consistently achieving this goal, with an increasing number of clients realising that value, seeking out our services and returning to us, repeatedly, to deliver to their requirements."

Furthermore, we attained our highest ever Net Profit After Tax figure, A$64.4 million - a remarkable achievement that reflects our unrelenting commitment to growth."
Civmec,2017-11,"We strengthened our cash position, transitioning from a net borrowing position of A$76.5 million in FY19 to a net cash position of A$24.5 million (excluding lease liabilities). Our increased net assets now stand at an impressive A$488.2 million. These achievements underscore the effectiveness of our financial strategy over the past fifteen years. We will continue to focus on cash generation and the maintenance of a strong balance sheet to support our strong operational performance and growth strategy."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our objective at Civmec is to create value for shareholders through delivering consistent, stable and reliable returns. Since our listing on the ASX, we have generated A$232.2 million in profit and returned more than A$75.5 million to our shareholders through dividends."

The Board has committed to a target of net zero emissions by 2050, and to achieve this has set a target of greater than 50% reduction in Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions intensity by 2030 (compared to 2022 levels)."

Civmec,2017-11,Annual Return: Dividends Paid In a 12-Month Period/Price at the Beginning of the Period + Capital Gain or Loss over 1 Year/Price 1 Year Ago (%)
Civmec,2017-11,Moving Average Price (n periods): Sum of Prices for each Period/Number of Periods
Civmec,2017-11,Price Close/Moving Avg Price: Latest Price/Moving Average Price
Civmec,2017-11,Price/NTA: Closing Share Price/Net Tangible Assets Per Share (times)
Civmec,2017-11,Relative Price Change [RPC]: Relative price change is price change of stock with respect to Benchmark Index
Civmec,2017-11,"Relative Strength (6 Months): Price close today/Price close 6 months ago, then ranked by percentile within the entire market."
Civmec,2017-11,TSR: Total Shareholder Returns is expressed as an annualized rate of return for shareholders after allowing for capital appreciation and dividend
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Index (VI): Number of shares traded in the period/Average number of shares traded for the period
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP): The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover divided by total volume in the same period.
Civmec,2017-11,"Data for the BuySellSignals algorithms is drawn from annual reports, company websites and similar sources of publicly available data. It should be used as a guide only."

To this end, we are consistently achieving this goal, with an increasing number of clients realising that value, seeking out our services and returning to us, repeatedly, to deliver to their requirements."

Our increased net assets now stand at an impressive A$488.2 million. These achievements underscore the effectiveness of our financial strategy over the past fifteen years. We will continue to focus on cash generation and the maintenance of a strong balance sheet to support our strong operational performance and growth strategy."

The Board has committed to a target of net zero emissions by 2050, and to achieve this has set a target of greater than 50% reduction in Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions intensity by 2030 (compared to 2022 levels)."

Civmec,2017-11,- The P/E of 11.9 multiplied by the P/NTA of 1.6 is 19.0. Being less than the Benjamin Graham benchmark of 22.5 the stock appears undervalued.
Civmec,2017-11,"- ""An earnings-to-price yield of at least twice the triple-A bond""; the stock's earning yield of 8.4% is 2.9 times the triple-A bond yield of 2.9%."
Civmec,2017-11,"- The P/E of 11.9 is 0.4 times the highest average P/E of 32.4 in the last five years. This is a value criterion, according to Benjamin Graham who described as a value criterion ""A P/E ratio down to less than four-tenth of the highest average P/E ratio the stock attained in the most recent five years""."
Civmec,2017-11,"- ""A dividend yield of at least two-thirds the triple-A bond yield""; the stock's dividend yield is 1.5 times the triple-A bond yield of 2.9%."
Civmec,2017-11,"-""Total debt less than tangible book value""; total debt of AUD66.7 million (US$44.2 million) is less than tangible book value of AUD420.6 million (US$279 million).-""Total debt equal or less than twice the net quick liquidation value""; total debt of AUD66.7 million (US$44.2 million) is 0.3 times the net liquidation value of AUD214.3 million (US$142.1 million)."

Civmec,2017-11,"The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover [or price at which shares were sold times the volume of shares] divided by the total volume and represents an average based on turnover of all transactions over the period. In the past week the Volume Weighted Average Price was SGD1.14, up from SGD1.11 in the previous week. Average weekly volume of 758,972 shares declined 18.9% from 936,025 shares. Civmec,2017-11,Civmec's trailing twelve months dividend is 4.85c. Its dividend yield at its current price is 4.25%. Its current price is at a 2.6% discount to its 52 week high. If Low Keng Huat (Singapore) was to return to its 52 week low its dividend yield would be 5.85%."

Civmec,2017-11,"The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover [or price at which shares were sold times the volume of shares] divided by the total volume and represents an average based on turnover of all transactions over the period. In the past week the Volume Weighted Average Price was $A1.38, up from $A1.31 in the previous week. Average weekly volume of 337,735 shares rose 5.4% from 320,550 shares. The 5-week VWAP is $A1.30."

Civmec,2017-11,"Stocks are scored on a set of parameters reflecting fundamental analytical tools involving valuation, size and financial performance. They are ranked according to the average values of those parameters. The highest ranking is 5 and the lowest ranking is 1."
Civmec,2017-11,Annual Return: Dividends Paid In a 12-Month Period/Price at the Beginning of the Period + Capital Gain or Loss over 1 Year/Price 1 Year Ago (%)
Civmec,2017-11,Moving Average Price (n periods): Sum of Prices for each Period/Number of Periods
Civmec,2017-11,Price Close/Moving Avg Price: Latest Price/Moving Average Price
Civmec,2017-11,Price/NTA: Closing Share Price/Net Tangible Assets Per Share (times)
Civmec,2017-11,Relative Price Change [RPC]: Relative price change is price change of stock with respect to Benchmark Index
Civmec,2017-11,"Relative Strength (6 Months): Price close today/Price close 6 months ago, then ranked by percentile within the entire market."
Civmec,2017-11,TSR: Total Shareholder Returns is expressed as an annualized rate of return for shareholders after allowing for capital appreciation and dividend
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Index (VI): Number of shares traded in the period/Average number of shares traded for the period
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP): The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover divided by total volume in the same period.
Civmec,2017-11,"Data for the BuySellSignals algorithms is drawn from annual reports, company websites and similar sources of publicly available data. It should be used as a guide only."

In the past week the Volume Weighted Average Price was $A1.38, up from $A1.31 in the previous week. Average weekly volume of 337,735 shares rose 5.4% from 320,550 shares. The 5-week VWAP is $A1.30."

Civmec,2017-11,Annual Return: Dividends Paid In a 12-Month Period/Price at the Beginning of the Period + Capital Gain or Loss over 1 Year/Price 1 Year Ago (%)
Civmec,2017-11,Moving Average Price (n periods): Sum of Prices for each Period/Number of Periods
Civmec,2017-11,Price Close/Moving Avg Price: Latest Price/Moving Average Price
Civmec,2017-11,Price/NTA: Closing Share Price/Net Tangible Assets Per Share (times)
Civmec,2017-11,Relative Price Change [RPC]: Relative price change is price change of stock with respect to Benchmark Index
Civmec,2017-11,"Relative Strength (6 Months): Price close today/Price close 6 months ago, then ranked by percentile within the entire market."
Civmec,2017-11,TSR: Total Shareholder Returns is expressed as an annualized rate of return for shareholders after allowing for capital appreciation and dividend
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Index (VI): Number of shares traded in the period/Average number of shares traded for the period
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP): The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover divided by total volume in the same period.
Civmec,2017-11,"Data for the BuySellSignals algorithms is drawn from annual reports, company websites and similar sources of publicly available data. It should be used as a guide only."

The Company provides heavy engineering and other services including fabrication, site civil works, pre-cast concrete and maintenance services. Civmec,2017-11,+ Net profit was up 11.7% from $37.8 million in FY2023 to $42.2 million in FY2024.
Civmec,2017-11,+ Earnings Per Share (EPS) was up 18.2% from 11.0c in FY2023 to 13.0c in FY2024.
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec today announced a final dividend of 3.50c per share, franked to 100%. The ex-dividend date is Monday, October 14, 2024 and the record date is Tuesday, October 15, 2024 and it is payable on Friday, October 25."
Civmec,2017-11,"Back in 2009, we had a vision: to create a successful, multidisciplined organisation with a variety of diverse and integrated capabilities. One of our early goals was to prove to our customers the value of local manufacturing and encourage more heavy engineering projects to stay within Australian shores. To this end, we are consistently achieving this goal, with an increasing number of clients realising that value, seeking out our services and returning to us, repeatedly, to deliver to their requirements."
Civmec,2017-11,"I am pleased to report that in FY24, Civmec achieved exceptional financial results, culminating in our revenue surpassing A$1 billion for the first time in our history. Furthermore, we attained our highest ever Net Profit After Tax figure, A$64.4 million - a remarkable achievement that reflects our unrelenting commitment to growth."
Civmec,2017-11,"We strengthened our cash position, transitioning from a net borrowing position of A$76.5 million in FY19 to a net cash position of A$24.5 million (excluding lease liabilities). Our increased net assets now stand at an impressive A$488.2 million. These achievements underscore the effectiveness of our financial strategy over the past fifteen years. We will continue to focus on cash generation and the maintenance of a strong balance sheet to support our strong operational performance and growth strategy."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our objective at Civmec is to create value for shareholders through delivering consistent, stable and reliable returns. Since our listing on the ASX, we have generated A$232.2 million in profit and returned more than A$75.5 million to our shareholders through dividends."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our Board of Directors has declared a final cash dividend of A$0.035 per share. The payment will bring the full-year dividend to A$0.06 per share, representing a 47% payout ratio, and will be paid on 25 October 2024."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our people are the heartbeat of our direct operations and support services, and, without them, we wouldn't be where we are today. During FY24, we provided employment either directly or indirectly for over 4,000 people, including almost 150 apprentices, graduates, and trainees."
Civmec,2017-11,"We also continued to equip workers with additional skills, delivering 56 units of competency to almost 2,500 participants through our in-house registered training organisation (RTO)."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our leadership and professional development programs, such as our internal LEAD program, were ongoing, reaffirming our strong commitment to the promotion of organic growth within the company. In fact, this year, it is pleasing to report that around 90 people completed our leading hand or supervisory position courses, successfully progressing to the next stages of their career with us."
Civmec,2017-11,"It's important that everyone at Civmec feels equally valued and welcome, so we continue to promote diversity across our facilities and sites with visible action and representation. This year, a personal highlight of mine was hosting the Matagarup Elders Group for a tour of our Henderson facility, during which the group generously provided insight into their culture and connection to the lands and waters in Perth."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our journey towards a more sustainable future continues, as we strive for the most effective management of our environmental, social and governance (ESG) risks, obligations and opportunities. The Board has committed to a target of net zero emissions by 2050, and to achieve this has set a target of greater than 50% reduction in Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions intensity by 2030 (compared to 2022 levels)."
Civmec,2017-11,"At Civmec, we are unwavering in our commitment to responsible corporate governance and transparency, striving for the highest levels of integrity and accountability. For the past twelve years, we have done so with the support of Independent Directors Chong Teck Sin, Wong Fook Choy Sunny, and Douglas Owen Chester, whose time with us will end in October 2024 due to SGX Listing Rules on director independence."
Civmec,2017-11,"Mr. Gary Gray is a distinguished professional with experience as the Australian Ambassador to Ireland, a former member of the Australian Parliament, and in senior executive and Board member roles. Mr. Ambrose Law is a seasoned Chartered Accountant with extensive experience in senior financial roles across multiple countries. I am confident that their strategic guidance and oversight will add great value, as we continue to deliver safely, sustainably, and in the best interests of our stakeholders."
Civmec,2017-11,"To conclude, I wish to thank all those who have played a role in our success, not just this year, but since we opened our doors in 2009. This includes our employees, our delivery partners, suppliers, clients, executive management team and our Board. As we prepare to bid our current Independent Directors farewell, I would like to take the opportunity to sincerely thank them for their insight and guidance over the years. Their contributions have been instrumental in our journey of success."
Civmec,2017-11,"Finally, to our shareholders, thank you for your continued trust and confidence in Civmec. Your ongoing support and encouragement are much appreciated."

Civmec,2017-11,3.1 Relative Value Indicators: Undervaluation compared with Index averages and bond yield
Civmec,2017-11,- Earnings yield of 9.3% is more attractive compared with the Australian average earning yield of 1.7%.

Civmec,2017-11,The dividend yield of 6.47% is 1.42 times the triple-A bond yield of 4.56%. The times factor of 1.42 is above the benchmark factor of 0.67 times set by Benjamin Graham.
Civmec,2017-11,The Dividend Yield of 6.5% is better than the Index average of 3.3%
Civmec,2017-11,"- The relative yield of the stock, defined by its yield of 6.5%, divided by average yield of dividend yielding stocks in the All Ordinaries Index of 3.3% is 196.1%. This suggests the stock is undervalued in dividend yield terms."
Civmec,2017-11,"- Total Liabilities/EBITDA of 4.6 is less than 5, this compares favourably with the Joseph Piotroski benchmark of 5."
Civmec,2017-11,"- Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 0.8. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued."

Civmec,2017-11,"Back in 2009, we had a vision: to create a successful, multidisciplined organisation with a variety of diverse and integrated capabilities. One of our early goals was to prove to our customers the value of local manufacturing and encourage more heavy engineering projects to stay within Australian shores. To this end, we are consistently achieving this goal, with an increasing number of clients realising that value, seeking out our services and returning to us, repeatedly, to deliver to their requirements."
Civmec,2017-11,"I am pleased to report that in FY24, Civmec achieved exceptional financial results, culminating in our revenue surpassing A$1 billion for the first time in our history. Furthermore, we attained our highest ever Net Profit After Tax figure, A$64.4 million - a remarkable achievement that reflects our unrelenting commitment to growth."
Civmec,2017-11,"We strengthened our cash position, transitioning from a net borrowing position of A$76.5 million in FY19 to a net cash position of A$24.5 million (excluding lease liabilities). Our increased net assets now stand at an impressive A$488.2 million. These achievements underscore the effectiveness of our financial strategy over the past fifteen years. We will continue to focus on cash generation and the maintenance of a strong balance sheet to support our strong operational performance and growth strategy."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our objective at Civmec is to create value for shareholders through delivering consistent, stable and reliable returns. Since our listing on the ASX, we have generated A$232.2 million in profit and returned more than A$75.5 million to our shareholders through dividends."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our Board of Directors has declared a final cash dividend of A$0.035 per share. The payment will bring the full-year dividend to A$0.06 per share, representing a 47% payout ratio, and will be paid on 25 October 2024."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our people are the heartbeat of our direct operations and support services, and, without them, we wouldn't be where we are today. During FY24, we provided employment either directly or indirectly for over 4,000 people, including almost 150 apprentices, graduates, and trainees."
Civmec,2017-11,"We also continued to equip workers with additional skills, delivering 56 units of competency to almost 2,500 participants through our in-house registered training organisation (RTO)."

Civmec,2017-11,Annual Return: Dividends Paid In a 12-Month Period/Price at the Beginning of the Period + Capital Gain or Loss over 1 Year/Price 1 Year Ago (%)
Civmec,2017-11,Moving Average Price (n periods): Sum of Prices for each Period/Number of Periods
Civmec,2017-11,Price Close/Moving Avg Price: Latest Price/Moving Average Price
Civmec,2017-11,Price/NTA: Closing Share Price/Net Tangible Assets Per Share (times)
Civmec,2017-11,Relative Price Change [RPC]: Relative price change is price change of stock with respect to Benchmark Index
Civmec,2017-11,"Relative Strength (6 Months): Price close today/Price close 6 months ago, then ranked by percentile within the entire market."
Civmec,2017-11,TSR: Total Shareholder Returns is expressed as an annualized rate of return for shareholders after allowing for capital appreciation and dividend
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Index (VI): Number of shares traded in the period/Average number of shares traded for the period
Civmec,2017-11,Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP): The Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is the summation of turnover divided by total volume in the same period.
Civmec,2017-11,"Data for the BuySellSignals algorithms is drawn from annual reports, company websites and similar sources of publicly available data. It should be used as a guide only."
Civmec,2017-11,{{20241104T054240.880+0000}}Monthly: Civmec (CVL: $A1.38) up 23% in 2 monthsAUSTRALIAN END-OF-MONTH STOCK REPORT
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec (ASX:CVL), Australia's 9th largest Capital Goods company by market cap, extended its gains in the past month, rising an additional 24.17c (or 21.2%) to close at $A1.38 on Thursday October 31. The shares have been up 26.12c (or 23.3%) over the past two months. Compared with the All Ordinaries Index which rose 105.4 points (or 1.3%) in the two months, this represented a relative price increase of 22.1%."
Civmec,2017-11,"The price ranged between a low of 1.1 on Wednesday, 2 Oct and a high of 1.4 on Monday, 28 Oct. In the past two months the market cap has jumped by $A423.4 million to $A701.8 million."
Civmec,2017-11,This has been propped up by strong volume of 3.0 times average for the month.
Civmec,2017-11,Price Volume Snapshot past 3 months (AUD) [*Volume Index of 3.1 means volume for the month was 3.1 times its 12-month average]
Civmec,2017-11,"The annual general meeting (AGM) was held on Wednesday, October 30."
Civmec,2017-11,The shares gained 9.5% in the 13 trading sessions since the ex-dividend date of October 14. The company paid a dividend of 3.50c per share. Based on dividends of 9.0c per share for the trailing twelve months and the last price of $A1.38 the dividend yield is 6.5%.
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec (ASX:CVL) reported net profit for the year-ended 30 June 2024 [FY2024] of $A64.4m, up 12% from $A57.7m in the previous year [FY2023]. Earnings per share (EPS) were up 18% from 11.0c in FY2023 to 13.0c in FY2024."
Civmec,2017-11,"CIVMEC (CVL) Stock Dashboard [traded in Australian Dollars, AUD] End-of-Day Thu, Oct 31"
Civmec,2017-11,VI* Volume Index = Number of shares traded today/Average number of shares traded per day.
Civmec,2017-11,"A year ago the exchange rate was USD 1 = 1.57 AUD. USD1000 would have bought $A1,569. A year ago the Civmec share price was 91.83c. $A1,569 would have bought 1,708.7 Civmec shares on that day. Those 1,708.7 shares would be worth $A2,358 at today's share price of $A1.38. At today's exchange rate of USD1=1.52 AUD this is equivalent to USD1,552. Dividends reinvested are worth $A135 ($139). PV$1000= $1,691."
Civmec,2017-11,Past quarter momentum up: Civmec soars 15% on high volume 2.1 times average.
Civmec,2017-11,[*Volume Index of 3.1 means volume for the month was 3.1 times its 12-month average]
Civmec,2017-11,[VWAP is defined as the Volume Weighted Average Price; High Low prices and VWAP are shown in Australian Dollars]
Civmec,2017-11,+ Net profit was up 11.7% from $38.2 million in FY2023 to $42.7 million in FY2024.
Civmec,2017-11,+ Earnings Per Share (EPS) was up 18.2% from 11.0c in FY2023 to 13.0c in FY2024.
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec today announced a final dividend of 3.50c per share, franked to 100%. The ex-dividend date is Monday, October 14, 2024 and the record date is Tuesday, October 15, 2024 and it is payable on Friday, October 25."
Civmec,2017-11,"Back in 2009, we had a vision: to create a successful, multidisciplined organisation with a variety of diverse and integrated capabilities. One of our early goals was to prove to our customers the value of local manufacturing and encourage more heavy engineering projects to stay within Australian shores. To this end, we are consistently achieving this goal, with an increasing number of clients realising that value, seeking out our services and returning to us, repeatedly, to deliver to their requirements."
Civmec,2017-11,"I am pleased to report that in FY24, Civmec achieved exceptional financial results, culminating in our revenue surpassing A$1 billion for the first time in our history. Furthermore, we attained our highest ever Net Profit After Tax figure, A$64.4 million - a remarkable achievement that reflects our unrelenting commitment to growth."
Civmec,2017-11,"We strengthened our cash position, transitioning from a net borrowing position of A$76.5 million in FY19 to a net cash position of A$24.5 million (excluding lease liabilities). Our increased net assets now stand at an impressive A$488.2 million. These achievements underscore the effectiveness of our financial strategy over the past fifteen years. We will continue to focus on cash generation and the maintenance of a strong balance sheet to support our strong operational performance and growth strategy."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our objective at Civmec is to create value for shareholders through delivering consistent, stable and reliable returns. Since our listing on the ASX, we have generated A$232.2 million in profit and returned more than A$75.5 million to our shareholders through dividends."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our Board of Directors has declared a final cash dividend of A$0.035 per share. The payment will bring the full-year dividend to A$0.06 per share, representing a 47% payout ratio, and will be paid on 25 October 2024."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our people are the heartbeat of our direct operations and support services, and, without them, we wouldn't be where we are today. During FY24, we provided employment either directly or indirectly for over 4,000 people, including almost 150 apprentices, graduates, and trainees."
Civmec,2017-11,"We also continued to equip workers with additional skills, delivering 56 units of competency to almost 2,500 participants through our in-house registered training organisation (RTO)."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our leadership and professional development programs, such as our internal LEAD program, were ongoing, reaffirming our strong commitment to the promotion of organic growth within the company. In fact, this year, it is pleasing to report that around 90 people completed our leading hand or supervisory position courses, successfully progressing to the next stages of their career with us."
Civmec,2017-11,"It's important that everyone at Civmec feels equally valued and welcome, so we continue to promote diversity across our facilities and sites with visible action and representation. This year, a personal highlight of mine was hosting the Matagarup Elders Group for a tour of our Henderson facility, during which the group generously provided insight into their culture and connection to the lands and waters in Perth."
Civmec,2017-11,"Our journey towards a more sustainable future continues, as we strive for the most effective management of our environmental, social and governance (ESG) risks, obligations and opportunities. The Board has committed to a target of net zero emissions by 2050, and to achieve this has set a target of greater than 50% reduction in Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions intensity by 2030 (compared to 2022 levels)."
Civmec,2017-11,"At Civmec, we are unwavering in our commitment to responsible corporate governance and transparency, striving for the highest levels of integrity and accountability. For the past twelve years, we have done so with the support of Independent Directors Chong Teck Sin, Wong Fook Choy Sunny, and Douglas Owen Chester, whose time with us will end in October 2024 due to SGX Listing Rules on director independence."
Civmec,2017-11,"Mr. Gary Gray is a distinguished professional with experience as the Australian Ambassador to Ireland, a former member of the Australian Parliament, and in senior executive and Board member roles. Mr. Ambrose Law is a seasoned Chartered Accountant with extensive experience in senior financial roles across multiple countries. I am confident that their strategic guidance and oversight will add great value, as we continue to deliver safely, sustainably, and in the best interests of our stakeholders."
Civmec,2017-11,"To conclude, I wish to thank all those who have played a role in our success, not just this year, but since we opened our doors in 2009. This includes our employees, our delivery partners, suppliers, clients, executive management team and our Board. As we prepare to bid our current Independent Directors farewell, I would like to take the opportunity to sincerely thank them for their insight and guidance over the years. Their contributions have been instrumental in our journey of success."
Civmec,2017-11,"Finally, to our shareholders, thank you for your continued trust and confidence in Civmec. Your ongoing support and encouragement are much appreciated."
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec has announced its Annual General Meeting will take place on Wednesday, October 30."
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec has announced its Extra Ordinary General Meeting will take place on Thursday, August 01."
Civmec,2017-11,June 13: Civmec: Target increased as Civmec aims to raise record amount for Vinnies
Civmec,2017-11,"With the Vinnies CEO Sleepout only one week away, Civmec has increased the fundraising target of its national campaign, with an aim to raise more money and awareness for people in need. Having reached his personal target of $100,000 earlier this week, Civmec CEO Pat Tallon is now aiming for $125,000, raising the Civmec team target to $145,000."
Civmec,2017-11,"Today, EGM Mylon Manusiu released his own video appeal, aiming to truly make a difference by raising as much money as possible for homelessness."
Civmec,2017-11,"Homelessness can happen to anyone. It may be an unfortunate life event, breakdown of a relationship, or unforeseen change in circumstances. It affects men and women, young and old, including many Australian children."
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec is relying on the generosity of its people, their friends and family, its suppliers, delivery partners, and the wider Australian public, to reach the target amount."
Civmec,2017-11,"If you are in a position to donate, please consider donating generously."
Civmec,2017-11,"Civmec today announced an interim dividend of 2.50c per share, franked to 100%. The ex-dividend date is Tuesday, March 26, 2024 and the record date is Wednesday, March 27, 2024 and it is payable on Monday, April 15."

Civmec,2017-11,3.2 Relative Value Indicators: Undervaluation compared with Index averages and bond yield
Civmec,2017-11,- Earnings yield of 9.4% is more attractive compared with the Australian average earning yield of 1.7%.
Civmec,2017-11,- The earnings yield of 9.4% is 2.1 times the 10-year bond yield of 4.6%.
Civmec,2017-11,The dividend yield of 6.52% is 1.43 times the triple-A bond yield of 4.56%. The times factor of 1.43 is above the benchmark factor of 0.67 times set by Benjamin Graham.
Civmec,2017-11,The Dividend Yield of 6.5% is better than the Index average of 3.3%
Civmec,2017-11,"- The relative yield of the stock, defined by its yield of 6.5%, divided by average yield of dividend yielding stocks in the All Ordinaries Index of 3.3% is 198.2%. This suggests the stock is undervalued in dividend yield terms."

Civmec,2017-11,"Mr. Patrick John Tallon was appointed to our Board on 27 March 2012. He is responsible for the development and performance of the Group, including building culture and leadership. Over the past 28 years, Mr. Tallon has accumulated significant knowledge and experience in all aspects of the construction industry and has been involved in many major oil and gas, mining and infrastructure projects."
Civmec,2017-11,"Mr. James Finbarr Fitzgerald was appointed to our Board on 27 March 2012. He is responsible for the corporate direction and implementing the company's vision and strategic direction. With more than 34 years' experience, he has extensive knowledge in civil, structural, mechanical and piping works, as well as insulation and modularisation of structures onshore and offshore."
Civmec,2017-11,"Mr. Kevin James Deery was appointed to our Board on 27 March 2012. He is responsible for overseeing the ongoing business operations of the Group's quality-orientated culture compliance and operational productivity. Mr. Deery has more than 20 years' experience having previously managed structural, mechanical and process piping construction works for major clients."
Civmec,2017-11,"Mr. Sunny Wong Fook Choy was appointed to our Board on 27 March 2012. He is a practising advocate and solicitor of the Supreme Court of Singapore and is currently the Managing Director of Wong Tan & Molly Lim LLC. He is also an independent director of China Medical (International) Group Limited, Excelpoint Technology Ltd., Mencast Holdings Ltd., InnoTek Ltd. and KTL Global Ltd. Mr. Wong holds a Bachelor of Law (Honours) from the National University of Singapore."
Civmec,2017-11,"Mr. Douglas Owen Chester was appointed to our Board on 2 November 2012. He is an Independent Director and Audit Chairman of Stamford Land Corporation Limited and Lead Independent Director of Kim Heng Offshore & Marine Holdings Limited. Prior to this appointment, he held the role of Australia's High Commissioner to Singapore. Mr. Chester holds a Bachelor of Science (Honours) from the Australian National University."
Civmec,2017-11,"Mr. Chong Teck Sin was appointed to our Board on 27 March 2012. Mr. Chong is currently an independent director of Changan Minsheng APLL Logistics Co. Ltd. and Audit Committee Chairman of AVIC International Maritime Holdings Limited, InnoTek Limited and Accordia Golf Trust Management Pte. Ltd. Mr. Chong has a Bachelor of Engineering from the University of Tokyo and a Masters of Business Administration from the National University of Singapore."

Civmec,2017-11,"Stocks are scored on a set of parameters reflecting fundamental analytical tools involving valuation, size and financial performance. They are ranked according to the average values of those parameters. The highest ranking is 5 and the lowest ranking is 1."
